vase.description: In Greek mythology, vases often symbolize offerings to gods or are associated with Pandora's box, which unleashed evils but retained hope.

trident.description: The trident is a symbol of Poseidon, Greek god of the sea, used to control storms and earthquakes.

lyre.description: The lyre, linked to Apollo, god of music and prophecy, represents harmony and artistic expression in Greek mythology.

helmet.description: The helmet, associated with Hades, grants invisibility and symbolizes his rule over the underworld.

shield.description: The shield, tied to Athena, goddess of wisdom, represents protection and strategic warfare in Greek mythology.

olive branch.description: The olive branch, a gift from Athena to Athens, symbolizes peace, victory, and the city's prosperity.

bow and arrow.description: The bow and arrow, wielded by Artemis, goddess of the hunt and moon, signify precision and independence.
